divs: sighting detailsat approximately 8pm or a few minutes after, a friend, my two children and i were returning to our home. while we were in front of the cited address, i was pointing out the stars in the belt of orion to my children when we noticed a "flock" of glowing birds in a perfect "v" moving across the sky at a very fast speed - at least twice as fast as i've ever seen birds move across the sky. at no time did any of the "birds" flap or change position relative to the other. though i didn't count them at the time, i recall 5-6 "birds" down each "wing" of the "v" with one in the lead (giving a total of 11-13). the "birds" appeared to be of uniform size and exhibited a uniform dull white-yellow glow. the "v" came almost directly overhead (approximately 80-85 deg. above the horizon) with a heading of approximately 350 deg in a straight line (as estimated using google earth). no sound was detected. initially, i believed the object was a flock of birds due to the distinct "v" shape; however, i noted it was moving too fast to be birds so i began to think it might be a plane based on our proximity to dulles airport. about this time, i was able to see the "bird" shapes more clearly and again thought it must be a flock. as the birds\object came over, i waited to hear a sound, however, no sound was heard by any of us. i lost sight of the object in nearby trees. i hoped i would be able to make out a shape behind the "birds" from the half moon, but i was not able to do so. i am not sure if it was a "trick of the trees" but the object may have begun to bank to the right just after it passed us. a pure guess as to the altitude of the object would be approximately 1000 feet agl. a number of commercial aircraft were in the area; however, they appear much higher in altitude and exhibit standard navigational and anti-collision lights. dulles airport is approximately 8nm wnw of our location. in an attempt to rule out a flock of birds flying very fast due to a tail wind, i checked local weather and winds aloft at dulles. they were: surface winds 200 deg at 8 knots and winds aloft were- kiad fl390 270 \ 55 kts -66���c fl340 290 \ 42 kts -55���c fl300 290 \ 34 kts -45���c fl240 290 \ 29 kts -31���c fl180 280 \ 39 kts -21���c 12,000 280 \ 31 kts -7���c 9,000 280 \ 46 kts -2���c 6,000 270 \ 48 kts 5���c 3,000 250 \ 31 kts weather was clear and visibility was 10 sm.

Summary: Glowing flock of birds moving very fast
